review_blob: just a bump up from a heineken.  Good, but probably not worth the extra costs to import the stuff.

Youll either love or hate this beer.  I would describe it as harsh initially, but revaling more and more complexity as you become acclimated to its high alcahol content.  Cherry and hints of carmel, subtle coffee flavors are all evident.  Full Bodies is a term being thrown around... I would agree.  A very different Sam Adams, perhaps the most misunderstood.

Good in its own right, the Raison DEtre came highly recommended.  It lacks the complexity I enjoy, and I think its citric undertones are not terribly raison specific.  Nevertheless, It had a great pallate with the perfect amount of hops.
At $10 a pack, Ill stick with my more trusted and less expensive brands.
A poor attempt on creating a holiday treat.  cranberry was too intense and overpowering(if you really like cranberries, this is your beer!).  Very little sweetness in this beer--hard for me to enjoy.

I agree that upon first tasting you feel a little overwhelmed with the vanilla.  However, once acclimated to the flavor, you notice all the rich subtleties.  A step up from Sam Adams Cream Stout--richer and more flavorful.
